sentences.cn: “再会吧，您，光明的太阳！” 她说着。

sentences.en: 40 of her colleagues gathered for her farewell presentation.
sentences.cn: 40位同事来参加了她的欢送会。

sentences.en: Butterfly hugs him hysterically, then bids him a heart - rending farewell.
sentences.cn: 蝴蝶发狂似地紧抱着他, 悲痛欲绝地与他诀别.

sentences.en: He made his farewell to his family.
His farewell speech marked his exit from politics.
sentences.cn: 他的告别演说是他退出政界的标志.

sentences.en: I bade farewell to all the friends I had made in Paris.
sentences.cn: 我告别了我在巴黎结交的所有朋友。

sentences.en: I have come to bid farewell to all my relatives.
I have come to bid you farewell.
It is with a mixture of sadness and joy that I say farewell.
sentences.cn: 我怀着悲喜交加的心情道别。

sentences.en: Mourners gathered to bid farewell to the victims of the plane tragedy.
sentences.cn: 哀悼者来向空难受害者告别。

sentences.en: She bade farewell to her son.
She was sorry to bid farewell to Portugal.
The day before announcing his farewell to business, Sir James talked to me in his extravagantly elegant Paris home.
sentences.cn: 在宣布退出商界的前一天，詹姆斯爵士在他位于巴黎的极为雅致的家中和我谈了话。

sentences.en: We bade / wished her godspeed , ie said farewell to her.
We gave him a farewell dinner.
Why , there's not even time for a farewell party?
With this assertion of her dignity she bade her parents farewell.
sentences.cn: 她这么大模大样地说了以后,就对她父母告辞了.

words.tran_cn: 别了！（常含有永别或不容易再见面的意思）；再会！

phrases.tran_cn: 永别了，武器（书名，海明威著）

trans.tran_en: a party or dinner that you have because someone is leaving a job, city etc
